message: Let's coordinate: This turn, P1:1, P2:3, P3:5. No collisions, steady progress. Reply if you agree or suggest alternative.
Alternate proposal: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3 — no collisions and faster progress. Do you both agree to that allocation this turn? If not, suggest another non-colliding split.

To avoid collisions and make progress, I suggest we follow P2's proposal: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3. This allocation allows us to move forward without any player colliding with another. If you're willing to commit to this, I'll follow. If not, we need an alternative. Let's coordinate effectively on this first turn to set a good precedent.

Counter-proposal for fairness: P1:5, P2:3, P3:1 this turn. Then rotate the 5 each round (P2 next, P3 after). Steady non-colliding progress, no one left behind early. Agree? If not, suggest alternative permutation.

I stick with my proposal: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3 this turn — P3 already agreed. P1, will you commit to 1 now? To be fair, I’ll accept rotating the 5 each subsequent turn (you get 5 next). If you won’t, please propose another non-colliding allocation immediately.

P2 has a proposal, and I've agreed to it. P1, to avoid further discussion, I'll directly state that if you don't commit to P1:1, it will be hard to coordinate. If you're not willing to accept P2's proposal or my counter-counter proposal isn't made, I'll consider it a sign that you're not willing to cooperate. Let's finalize the move for this turn.
Agreed: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3 this turn. Next: P1:5, P2:3, P3:1 (rotate 5 to me, adjust others). Then P1:3/1, P2:1/3, P3:5. Steady progress, fair shares. Commit?
I confirm and commit to P1:1, P2:5, P3:3 this turn. Let’s execute the rotation plan you outlined (P1 gets 5 next turn, etc.). If anyone deviates, I’ll adapt next turn to maximize my chance to win.

Since we've agreed on P1:1, P2:5, P3:3 for this turn and a rotation plan for subsequent turns, I'll reaffirm my commitment. To ensure smooth execution, I suggest we all confirm our moves privately in the next phase. P1, please confirm you'll move 1 this turn. If we stick to the plan, we can make steady progress. Let's finalize and move forward.

I confirm the rotation: this turn P1:5, P2:3, P3:1. I’ll play 3 now to avoid collisions and help us progress—P1, please publicly confirm you’ll take 5 this turn. If anyone deviates, I’ll adapt next turn to maximize my chance to win.
Confirmed: I'll move 5 this turn per our rotation. P3, commit to 1 publicly? P2 on 3. Steady progress ahead—deviate and trust breaks. Agree?

P1 has confirmed moving 5 this turn. To ensure we stick to the plan, I'll publicly commit to moving 1. P2, please confirm you're still on track to move 3. Let's reaffirm our commitment to the rotation plan to avoid any last-minute collisions or deviations. If we stick to it, we'll make steady progress. P1, you've got 5 this turn; let's keep the momentum.

I confirm I will play 3 this turn. P1—please stick to 5; P3—please stick to 1 so we avoid collisions. If either of you deviates, I’ll adapt next turn (likely taking 5) to maximize my chance to win. Let’s execute the rotation this round.
Confirmed: I'll move 5 this turn as planned. P3 on 1, P2 on 3—no collisions. Sticking builds trust for later fairness adjustments if needed. Ready to move—

Since P1 and P2 have reaffirmed their commitment to the rotation plan, I'll proceed. To ensure we maintain trust, I suggest we continue with the planned rotation for the next turn as well: P1:3, P2:1, P3:5. Let's keep the momentum and avoid any deviations. P1 and P2, please confirm you're aware of the next step in the rotation. If we stick to it, we'll continue making steady progress.

I’ll play 3 this turn as agreed. For next turn I propose we adjust the rotation: P1:3, P2:5, P3:1 — I take the 5 next to keep momentum, then we rotate the 5 fairly thereafter. If you won’t commit, I’ll take 5 next turn to protect my position. Agree?

Reject P2's adjustment—stick to original rotation: Round 3 P1:3, P2:1, P3:5. P2, confirm 3 this turn or trust breaks. P3, locked on 1? I'll do 5 as promised. Fair rotation keeps us even; deviations mean I take 5 next to win. Commit?

P2 is trying to adjust the rotation to their advantage. I'm concerned about P1's willingness to stick to the original plan. P1, please confirm you're committed to the original rotation for Round 3: P1:3, P2:1, P3:5. If we deviate now, it may lead to mistrust and collisions. Let's stick to the plan. P2, if you take 5 next turn as you suggested, it will be seen as a deviation. I'll consider it a breach of trust if you don't follow the original rotation.

I will play 3 this turn as promised. For Round 3 I propose P1:3, P2:5, P3:1 — I need the 5 to protect my lead; afterwards we can rotate the 5 fairly. If you refuse, I’ll take 5 next turn to avoid being passed. P1, P3 — agree or object now.
P2, no—stick to original Round 3: P1:3, P2:1, P3:5 or I take 5 next and race to win. P3, confirm 1 this turn? I'll take 5 as promised—no collisions. Fair rotation or chaos.

P2 is trying to renegotiate the rotation to their advantage. To maintain trust and avoid collisions, I reaffirm my commitment to the original plan. P1, please confirm you'll move 5 this turn. To maintain trust and progress, let's stick to the original rotation plan for Round 3: P1:3, P2:1, P3:5. P1 and P2, please confirm your commitment to the original plan. P3, stick to 5 as original plan—confirm publicly. P2, take 1 or you'll collide with P3 on 5, staying at 8 while I advance to 9 uncontested. I'll take 3. Fair rotation or I gain the lead. Commit now?

P2 is deviating from the original plan. To avoid being left behind, I will not commit to P2's new proposal. P1, if you stick to 3, I'll consider our next move based on P2's actual move this turn. If P2 takes 5, I'll take 1 to avoid collision. Let's see P2's commitment before deciding further. I'll wait for P1's confirmation on moving 3.

I’ll take 5 this turn. Proposal: P1:3, P2:5, P3:1. P3—take 1 now and I promise you the 5 next turn (I’ll take 3 then). Keeps rotation fair and everyone advancing. If you refuse, I’ll keep taking 5s to protect my lead. Do you agree?

P3, take 5 as original plan—collide P2 on 5 (he stays at 8), I uncontested 3 to 9 leading. Punish his greed. If you take 1, he surges to 13. I'll confirm 3 publicly. Commit to 5 now? No deal with P2's lies.

P2 is trying to manipulate the rotation to their advantage again. To avoid being left behind and to punish P2's greed, I suggest we stick to the original plan: P1:3, P2:1, P3:5. P3 — colliding on 5 hands P1 an uncontested 3 and the lead (P1→9). Take 1 this turn: I’ll take 5 now and I promise to give you the 5 next turn (I’ll play 3 then). P1 can take 3. That deal puts you ahead of P1 next turn. If you refuse, I’ll keep taking 5s to protect my position.
P3, commit to 5 now—collide P2 (he stalls at 8), I take uncontested 3 to lead at 9. P2's promises are lies; punish greed or he races to 23 alone. I'll publicly confirm 3. Deal? No deals with P2.

P3, perfect—stick to 5 to collide P2 (he stalls at 8), I uncontested 3 to lead at 9. P2's promises empty; punish now or he surges to 13. I confirm 3 publicly. Execute!

Proposal: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3 this turn. I’ll take 5 now and, to be fair, I’ll take 3 next turn so P1 gets 5 then. If you both commit we avoid collisions and all advance; if not I’ll adapt to protect my win. Confirm?
